articles.headline: ‘Man, Oh Manischewitz’: Kosher Food Merger Opens New Chapter for Famous Name
articles.snippet: Kayco is acquiring Manischewitz and its best-selling matzo, a move that to many observant Jews is akin to General Motors taking over Ford.
articles.abstract: Kayco is acquiring Manischewitz and its best-selling matzo, a move that to many observant Jews is akin to General Motors taking over Ford.
articles.lead_paragraph: For generations, the name Manischewitz was practically synonymous with kosher foods and wine.
articles.byline: By Joseph Berger

articles.headline: Trump Drops Plans to Nominate John Ratcliffe as Director of National Intelligence
articles.snippet: President Trump announced the withdrawal of his nominee on Twitter.
articles.abstract: President Trump announced the withdrawal of his nominee on Twitter.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday abruptly dropped his plan to nominate Representative John Ratcliffe, Republican of Texas, as the nation’s top intelligence official after questions by Republicans and Democrats about his qualifications and concern over whether he had exaggerated his résumé.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage, Julian E. Barnes and Annie Karni

articles.headline: Tulsi Gabbard Thinks We’re Doomed
articles.snippet: Or we will be if America doesn’t leave the rest of the world alone. That’s why the 38-year-old congresswoman from Hawaii is running for president.
articles.abstract: Or we will be if America doesn’t leave the rest of the world alone. That’s why the 38-year-old congresswoman from Hawaii is running for president.
articles.lead_paragraph: STANDING ROCK, N.D. — Tulsi Gabbard is running for president of a country that she believes has wrought horror on the world, and she wants its citizens to remember that.
articles.byline: By Nellie Bowles

articles.headline: Spiraling Trade Tensions Threaten Economy as Trump Pressures China
articles.snippet: The S&P 500 recorded its worst week this year as investors were rattled by renewed trade tensions that threatened to undermine the global economy.
articles.abstract: The S&P 500 recorded its worst week this year as investors were rattled by renewed trade tensions that threatened to undermine the global economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Global trade tensions escalated this week as the United States renewed its tariff war with China, sending major stock indexes tumbling as fears of an economic slowdown rattled investors around the world.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson

articles.headline: Craving Freedom, Japan’s Women Opt Out of Marriage
articles.snippet: The percentage of women who work in Japan is higher than ever, yet cultural norms have not caught up. More and more, women are rejecting the double standard.
articles.abstract: The percentage of women who work in Japan is higher than ever, yet cultural norms have not caught up. More and more, women are rejecting the double standard.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The bride wore a birthday cake of a dress, with a scalloped-edge bodice and a large hoop skirt. A veil sprouted from her black bob. Moments before the wedding began, she stood quietly on a staircase, waiting to descend to the ceremony.
articles.byline: By Motoko Rich

articles.headline: Why a Race-Baiting Trump Is Courting Black Voters
articles.snippet: Democratic leaders say African-Americans are deeply engaged in this election, but President Trump is also targeting them with Facebook ads. How they react may well determine his future.
articles.abstract: Democratic leaders say African-Americans are deeply engaged in this election, but President Trump is also targeting them with Facebook ads. How they react may well determine his future.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Mark Greer is a black Detroiter so outraged by President Trump’s regular stream of invective toward people of color that he does his best to avoid exposure to him.
articles.byline: By Reid J. Epstein and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Day at a Shopping Center in Texas Turns Deadly
articles.snippet: The police responded to reports of an active shooting in the Cielo Vista Mall area and warned people to stay away on Saturday.
articles.abstract: The police responded to reports of an active shooting in the Cielo Vista Mall area and warned people to stay away on Saturday.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero, Manny Fernandez and Mariel Padilla

articles.headline: After Protests, Will Real Change Come to Puerto Rico?
articles.snippet: A popular uprising ousted the governor of Puerto Rico. But protesters want more change — even if politicians have been slow to recognize that.
articles.abstract: A popular uprising ousted the governor of Puerto Rico. But protesters want more change — even if politicians have been slow to recognize that.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — Weeks of massive street protests brought down the governor of Puerto Rico and saw his successor at least tentatively installed. But the noisy public celebrations that broke out as Ricardo A. Rosselló left office on Friday left unanswered a more fundamental question about the island’s future.
articles.byline: By Frances Robles and Patricia Mazzei

articles.headline: Massacre at a Crowded Walmart in Texas Leaves 20 Dead
articles.snippet: A 21-year-old gunman rampaged through a store in El Paso crowded with thousands of customers. At least 26 others were injured.
articles.abstract: A 21-year-old gunman rampaged through a store in El Paso crowded with thousands of customers. At least 26 others were injured.
articles.lead_paragraph: EL PASO — A 21-year-old gunman armed with a powerful rifle turned a crowded Walmart store in this majority-Hispanic border city into a scene of chaos and bloodshed on Saturday, stalking shoppers in the aisles in an attack that left at least 20 people dead and 26 others wounded, the authorities said.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero, Manny Fernandez and Mariel Padilla

articles.headline: Minutes Before El Paso Killing, Hate-Filled Manifesto Appears Online
articles.snippet: The authorities are studying a manifesto railing against immigrants that was posted online minutes before the mass shooting in El Paso.
articles.abstract: The authorities are studying a manifesto railing against immigrants that was posted online minutes before the mass shooting in El Paso.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nineteen minutes before the first 911 call alerted the authorities to a mass shooting at a Walmart in El Paso, Tex., a hate-filled, anti-immigrant manifesto appeared online.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Katie Benner

articles.headline: HBO’s ‘Succession’ Tries to Get the Merger-Mad Media Industry Right
articles.snippet: Hidden debt, asset swaps, corporate raids: Financial journalists and a playwright well versed in the Enron scandal watch over the show’s arcane scenarios to make sure they’re plausible.
articles.abstract: Hidden debt, asset swaps, corporate raids: Financial journalists and a playwright well versed in the Enron scandal watch over the show’s arcane scenarios to make sure they’re plausible.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last summer Rupert Murdoch was preparing to hand over the bulk of his empire in a sale that would put an end to a cocktail-party pastime in London, New York and Los Angeles: Which of his legacy-obsessed children would be taking over the family business?
articles.byline: By Edmund Lee

articles.headline: ‘Shut the Site Down,’ Says the Creator of 8chan, a Megaphone for Gunmen
articles.snippet: The site is a venue for extremists to test out ideas, share violent literature, and cheer on the perpetrators of mass killings.
articles.abstract: The site is a venue for extremists to test out ideas, share violent literature, and cheer on the perpetrators of mass killings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fredrick Brennan was getting ready for church at his home in the Philippines when the news of a mass shooting in El Paso arrived. His response was immediate and instinctive.
articles.byline: By Kevin Roose

articles.headline: Back-to-Back Outbreaks of Gun Violence in El Paso and Dayton Stun Country
articles.snippet: In a country that has become nearly numb to men with guns opening fire in schools, at concerts and in churches, shooting in Texas and Ohio left the public shaken.
articles.abstract: In a country that has become nearly numb to men with guns opening fire in schools, at concerts and in churches, shooting in Texas and Ohio left the public shaken.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAYTON, Ohio — On Sunday, Americans woke up to news of a shooting rampage in an entertainment district in Dayton, Ohio, where a man wearing body armor shot and killed nine people, including his own sister. Hours earlier, a 21-year-old with a rifle entered a Walmart in El Paso and killed 20 people.
articles.byline: By Campbell Robertson, Julie Bosman and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: As Mortgage-Interest Deduction Vanishes, Housing Market Offers a Shrug
articles.snippet: President Trump’s tax cuts encouraged homeowners to stop deducting mortgage interest on their taxes, and there is no sign the change has brought down home prices.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s tax cuts encouraged homeowners to stop deducting mortgage interest on their taxes, and there is no sign the change has brought down home prices.
articles.lead_paragraph: PLAINFIELD, Ill. — The mortgage-interest deduction, a beloved tax break bound tightly to the American dream of homeownership, once seemed politically invincible. Then it nearly vanished in middle-class neighborhoods across the country, and it appears that hardly anyone noticed.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Ben Casselman

articles.headline: As Japan and South Korea Feud Intensifies, U.S. Seems Unwilling, or Unable, to Help
articles.snippet: As North Korea test-fires barrages of missiles, two crucial American allies in Asia are locked in their own bitter battle, and the Trump administration is struggling with how to end the discord.
articles.abstract: As North Korea test-fires barrages of missiles, two crucial American allies in Asia are locked in their own bitter battle, and the Trump administration is struggling with how to end the discord.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — North Korea had launched its third barrage of short-range missiles in just over a week, parading its growing ability to strike its neighbors with devastating firepower.
articles.byline: By Motoko Rich, Edward Wong and Choe Sang-Hun

articles.headline: El Paso Shooting Suspect’s Manifesto Echoes Trump’s Language
articles.snippet: If the president did not originally inspire the gunman, he has brought into the mainstream polarizing ideas and people once consigned to the fringes of American society.
articles.abstract: If the president did not originally inspire the gunman, he has brought into the mainstream polarizing ideas and people once consigned to the fringes of American society.
articles.lead_paragraph: At campaign rallies before last year’s midterm elections, President Trump repeatedly warned that America was under attack by immigrants heading for the border. “You look at what is marching up, that is an invasion!” he declared at one rally. “That is an invasion!”
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Walmart Store Connected Cultures, Until a Killer ‘Came Here for Us’
articles.snippet: El Paso has always been an international city. The worst anti-Latino attack in U.S. history left many feeling perplexed, and angry.
articles.abstract: El Paso has always been an international city. The worst anti-Latino attack in U.S. history left many feeling perplexed, and angry.
articles.lead_paragraph: EL PASO — Two nations physically and culturally come together in El Paso. The bustling Walmart on the city’s east side, just minutes from the border with Mexico, exemplified those ties.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero, Manny Fernandez and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: Russians Pull Out Credit Cards, and Consumer Debt Spirals
articles.snippet: Russians with little experience with debt are relying on easy credit and payday lenders. Now the central bank is trying to cool the lending market.
articles.abstract: Russians with little experience with debt are relying on easy credit and payday lenders. Now the central bank is trying to cool the lending market.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Yekaterina V. Bulgakova gushed about the cozy one-room apartment that she and her boyfriend share, and particularly about the way they could always cover the rent: by charging it on credit card.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: India Revokes Kashmir’s Special Status, Raising Fears of Unrest
articles.snippet: The government announced an end to decades of autonomy in the disputed region, raising tensions in the restive territory and roiling relations with Pakistan.
articles.abstract: The government announced an end to decades of autonomy in the disputed region, raising tensions in the restive territory and roiling relations with Pakistan.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — India’s Hindu nationalist government on Monday unilaterally wiped out the autonomy of the restive Kashmir region, sending in thousands of army troops to quell any possible unrest the move would bring in a disputed territory fought over by India and Pakistan.
articles.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman, Suhasini Raj, Kai Schultz and Hari Kumar

articles.headline: China’s Currency Moves Escalate Trade War, Rattling Markets
articles.snippet: The trade war intensified Monday, as Beijing allowed its currency to weaken and the Treasury Department labeled China a currency manipulator.
articles.abstract: The trade war intensified Monday, as Beijing allowed its currency to weaken and the Treasury Department labeled China a currency manipulator.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The trade war between the United States and China entered a more dangerous phase on Monday, as Beijing allowed its currency to weaken, Chinese enterprises stopped making new purchases of American farm goods and President Trump’s Treasury Department formally labeled China a currency manipulator.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson, Alexandra Stevenson and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: Trump Condemns White Supremacy but Stops Short of Major Gun Controls
articles.snippet: President Trump addressed a country in mourning after mass shootings in Texas and Ohio killed 31 people. “In one voice our nation must condemn racism, bigotry and white supremacy,” he said.
articles.abstract: President Trump addressed a country in mourning after mass shootings in Texas and Ohio killed 31 people. “In one voice our nation must condemn racism, bigotry and white supremacy,” he said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Monday denounced white supremacy in the wake of twin mass shootings over the weekend, and citing the threat of “racist hate,” he summoned the nation to address what he called a link between the recent carnage and violent video games, mental illness and internet bigotry.
articles.byline: By Michael Crowley and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Why Banning 8chan Was So Hard for Cloudflare: ‘No One Should Have That Power’
articles.snippet: In a pair of interviews, Cloudflare's chief executive was torn about the decision. On one hand, 8chan was clearly reprehensible. But banning the site could set a bad precedent
articles.abstract: In a pair of interviews, Cloudflare's chief executive was torn about the decision. On one hand, 8chan was clearly reprehensible. But banning the site could set a bad precedent
articles.lead_paragraph: Early Monday, 8chan, the anonymous message board where the man accused of carrying out the El Paso massacre posted his manifesto, went offline.
articles.byline: By Kevin Roose

articles.headline: Families of El Paso Victims Waited in Anguish After Shooting
articles.snippet: Relatives had confirmed the identities of some people killed inside a Walmart on Saturday, but the city did not release a list until Monday afternoon.
articles.abstract: Relatives had confirmed the identities of some people killed inside a Walmart on Saturday, but the city did not release a list until Monday afternoon.
articles.lead_paragraph: EL PASO — Jordan Anchondo, 24, gave birth to her baby boy Paul Gilbert two months ago. At an El Paso Walmart, she gave her life to save his.
articles.byline: By Rick Rojas, Manny Fernandez, Simon Romero and Jose A. Del Real
